Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, nice rooms and a safe bet ...”
Reviews.Author: Kurple
Reviews.Content: I came to Istanbul with wife my parents and two cousins (m/22, f31) for a break. It was really hard for us to choose the right place being budget and location conscious. The hotel is nice located in the old city but around 10 minutes for the best attracts ... blue mosque etc. The rooms are a little small but really well presented with clean up to date bathrooms. The staff can't do enough to please their clients, wifi is provided all over the hotel and there is a lovel terrace area on the 4th floor to watch the roof top views. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, clean but be ready to ask multiple times for answers”
Reviews.Author: socialtalkers
Reviews.Content: We really, really enjoyed our trip to Istanbul. It was after two weeks of traveling in Greece so we were ready to relax a little. The staff was welcoming and tried to tell us about things we could do besides seeing the amazing sites. I would recommend doing some research on your own and walking around to find restaurants instead of booking what they recommend. The hotel is right down the street from the famous Cemberlitas hamam and near the Grand Bazaar. Walk two hotels down and you'll be at the best rooftop bar in town and a great view of the Blue Mosque. Staff isn't really responsive and had to be pressed to give answers about pick up times for tours and laundry services. The internet WiFi is spotty but the computer in the lobby has internet and is free. The rooms were clean and the breakfast very good with variety. You can fill your water bottles from the breakfast room too. The tram stop is right outside and you can go anywhere for less than a dollar. I highly recommend this hotel as it is close to all the things you'd want to see.

Reviews.Title: “The location makes up for Antea's shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: travelfreak53
Reviews.Content: I was a bit leery of staying in the Hotel Antea, based upon some of the reviews here. But, our agent booked us there and we decided to make the best of it. While I agree that the rooms are pretty small and the bathtubs are a challenge to get into and out of, the location and the service of this hotel more than made up for its shortcomings. First, the location. How can you beat being mere steps from the tram stop, 5 minutes from all the top sites to visit (Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Hippodrome etc), close to restaurants, banks, shops etc? We were more than happy to deal with some inconveniences in order to have the comfort of short walks and easy access to everything. Secondly, the staff. Some reviewers criticized them for indifference. I couldn't disagree more! Everyone was friendly at check in and check out. One morning we had to catch an early flight to Izmir and had to check out at 5 am. I requested a breakfast box the previous night. They said no, that we would have breakfast in the dining room. At 4:45, we were given our hot tea, a plate of meat, cheese, bread, fruit etc, all set out on our usual table. Another example....one evening we were waiting in the lobby for a restaurant shuttle. An elderly gentleman (not a guest in this hotel), fell down on the sidewalk outside, breaking his glasses and suffering a significant cut on his forehead. He was helped inside by a passer by, and immediately the desk clerk came out with cotton batting and antibacterial ointment and proceeded to clean the wound and make sure the gentleman was OK. He spent a good 20 minutes with him. This is not an indication of an indifferent staff! Finally, the breakfast. Yes, the juice was horrendous! But we found the same product in every hotel in Turkey. I can't imagine why they use Tang or orange flavored syrup instead of the real thing, but that's the case. The other items were fine. Coffee and tea, cheeses, meats, hard boiled eggs, little sausages, fruit, cereals, olives....yes it was the same every day, but there was enough variety so that it wasn't repetitive. One could stay there a week and have a different breakfast every day. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to those who are used to grandiose rooms, luxurious baths and elegant environments. The Antea provides an affordable option to those of house who want to travel but can't afford the Four Seasons. It is clean, acceptably comfortable and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, central location easy access to tourist sites”
Reviews.Author: Trip-advise45
Reviews.Content: convenient to walk around the sites, friendly staff, antique furniture and building and Comfortable facilities, but not all as advertised. Relaxing atmosphere in the dining room. enough food and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “It's not a hotel - it's an endurance test!”
Reviews.Author: expectant customer
Reviews.Content: I had two rooms at the Antea - so here is my review of both: I booked a double room and was given a twin with two small, hard beds. It was number 302. The shower/toilet was incredible, just TINY! The Guiness book of records need to check it out - The world's tiniest bathroom! So small, you cannot even open the door. Yes, Really. Getting in and out of the shower for a 6ft 4 in person is best described as dangerous. Very difficult to do. The step is too high, too awkward. Minibar is expensive at 5TL a softdrink. The TV - 19 channels in Turkish, no other language channels. Very hard to sleep. Noise comes from next door, the street and the corridor. The air con has two modes, "Hot and quiet" or "cool and noisy". Either way, you cannot get to sleep. After 2 nights, I moved to 305. A double bed (the mattress is 6 inches smaller than the bed base(?!) A slightly bigger room, but still small. Bathroom slightly bigger, you CAN open the door to this one. The TV has 26 channels, some in other languages (so why not in all rooms?) This room looked out onto a dark central alley. Turkish music came out - rather loudly from about 10 30 to 11 00 pm, so I could not sleep. Then some jolly Turkish chap telephoned my room after midnight and woke me up - wrong room number, but he still woke me up. Air con is the same as the other room, "hot and quiet" or "noisy and cool". The bedroom light switch - NOW GET THIS - Is built into the bed's headboard! Yes, really (see photo) This means, that as you turn over in bed, you get to switch the lights on!!!! I managed it 3 times, waking myself up each time!!! Oh what great fun. (Just Bizarre!) Oh, and the showeroom has a high, sharp marble step - you cannot miss hitting it with your foot - OUCH! The restaurant and bar - they seem to be there, but not operating - I guess they have given in to the restaurant competition along the road and given up - they need to do the same with the rooms. Breakfast is downstairs in the basement, no natural light. The orange "juice" is just nasty "squash" - come on, get some juice in, chaps? Some of the food could be upgraded - lots of it, just could be a bit nicer. I asked two times about the 05 35 bus to the airport. Decided to take it this morning. When I came down, and asked again, I was told I needed a ticket - and it was full. (why was I not told before?) So instead of a 10TL bus, I had a 55 TL taxi - THANKS VERY MUCH!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly stuff”
Reviews.Author: ocghro
Reviews.Content: Nice and friendly hotel. Stayed 2 nights with my family and my friends, got a nice barbeque on the top of the hotel in the last night. Nice rooms, clean, but the air conditioning system was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: JodyS_10
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at the Antea. The location absolutely can't be beat. Very close to everything, but not on the "main tourist drag." And there was free wifi IN THE ROOM!! Granted, the bathtubs are a bit of a challenge, but overall, it was a great stay. I had need of a Emergency Room (but that's another story!) and the staff were very accommodating. In fact, the wonderful woman who took care of my room was like a second mother. I have great memories of the Antea, and am very confused by some of the negative comments I've seen. As a solo traveler, I was very impressed by the way the manager and staff made my stay a positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place Nice Price”
Reviews.Author: redgoblin
Reviews.Content: We were in istanbul for the Soniphere Concerts .We look for couple hotels for stay . There are many hotels around Sultan Ahmet (Blue Mosque) , But Antea differs from other hotels with the price .Ä°ts price is cheaper almost % 50 than the others. Rooms are a bit small but its suitable for 3 or 4 people. But it does not important becouse you wil be use the hotel only for sleeptime .Because there are a lot of thing to see and you will not stay in the hotel. Ä° would stronly recommend to you.

Reviews.Title: “Hot, nasty, dirty and the staff couldn't have cared less!”
Reviews.Author: SurreyCholly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated BUT that's all. The staff were at best indifferent and at worse morose and rude. The computer didn't work, making it difficult to confirm our return flight {important as it was a BA flight}. I asked for another pillow as there was only one each in the room which, bye the way, was very cramped. We were given another two grudgingly. The airconditioning in our room was broken and we had to go and buy a fan as it was about 10 degrees hotter in the room than outside. The bathroom was odd and small and any traveller who was large or infirm could not have used the bath/shower facility. The breakfast was inedible. No really inedible! There was a nasty syrupy orange juice having no relationship to a real orange. The milk for the cereal was left out in the warm room and would become more and more "off" as the morning wore on. There was cheap cake--at breakfast time and bicuits that looked very old and crumbly. There was a very unpleasant spam type meat that was wheeled out every day and became increasingly curl ed and off colour. The cooked choice tasted of powdered egg and so I tried that only once! We found that if anything ran out it was not replaced. The standard of cleanliness left a lot to be desired. Our room was borderline OK but the rest of the hotel, especially around the breakfast area was filthy. The fixtures and fittings were abysmal---cheap and falling apart with exposed wiring everywhere. There were damp stains on the ceiling and peeling wallpaper in our room--and everywhere else in the hotel. The photograph of the roof terrace must have been taken by a very inventive photographer. In actual fact it was a small area with a few tables and a view of the backs of buildings. A small view of the sea could be seen also. On leaving the room, the electricity would turn itself off, thereby defrosting the minibar and so we returned every time to puddles on the floor. Although not the hotel's fault, there was continuous noise at night from the building works taking place across the street. Please dont waste your money on this travesty of a hotel. I wouldn't give one star!

Reviews.Title: “Better Off Sleeping in a Tin Shack”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCrazyMan
Reviews.Content: This place was horrid! The water went out multiple times during our visit. The staff were unhelpful and rude. For the price paid, I recommend you pay for the cab ride and NOT try to stay by the Blue Mosque. This hotel ruined our entire trip. They were insincere and indifferent to making our visit pleasant. The rooms were small, and the sheets looked dirty. The lobby smelled and internet was inconsistent. It was slow and problematic throughout our visit. The hotel bathrooms were average in terms of aesthetics, but the door barely closed. Construction was going on outside during our windows as well.This led to a horrible nights sleep. This hotel is NOT Boutique. More like BOOTYique. Free breakfast was the SAME thing every day. Yes, it was free, but pay the extra $10 and stay at a nicer place. The manager did not even take the time to apologize when we asked to speak to him. Might as well slap me in the face next time. I'm a very open and understanding person. However, the staff at this hotel tested my patience. Reccomended Hotels: Hotel Sultanamen (next door), or anything in Taksim.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off!!”
Reviews.Author: bedofrazors04
Reviews.Content: We first arrived at this hotel with great expectations but was quickly let down when we saw our room. It was so small, dingy and dirty. The bathroom was so small two people couldnt fit in there at the same time. If this wasnt a reason to leave the fact that they over charged us by 13 dollars cause when they asked us if we knew the prices we said the price that we thought we saw on the website but it was really 13 dollars more. Instead of informing us we had the wrong price, the reseptionist said yes and continued to check us in. So this place sucked and they literally ripped us off!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: classybird_10
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Lovely hotel but v small rooms and miniscule bathroom. Breakfast good. Plenty of restaurants easy walk away. Major sights also within walking distance. Brilliant turkish bath nearby. Helpful hotel staff. Taxi reasonable price from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm. Position fine, atmosphere poor”
Reviews.Author: JS52
Reviews.Content: Just back from five nights. In terms of the Antea's postion, it's just fine. The Blue Mosque is five minutes away down a back street, the Aghia Sofia is ten minutes away, the Topkapi another five minutes beyond that, and the Grand Bazaar and the Cemberlitas Hamam only three minutes around the corner. There are some good restaurants around, and plenty which will do the standard shish kebabs which are tasty and filling enough (although we never quite had the courage for the doner kebaps). However the hotel is a bit low-key. Breakfast is pretty average, but acceptable. Orr room on the second floor looked out into a light well, which was a little disappointing, although I hadn't been expecting a spectacular Istanbul skyline view. Although we had asked for a double, we had a triple with all three beds rammed together. Fine, but it left very little room. The shower needed some agility to get into and - more especially - to get out of, and might be worrying for older travellers. I couldn't get over how uninspired the reception staff were. Never greeted you coming in or going out, never a word of conversation, and - oddly - never a smile to show they were grateful that you were spending your money with them. We had a late night drink on the roof terrace of the Pierre Loti 50m up the road towards the trams; if rooms can be had at the same price, this might be worth looking at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: khani3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is around 5 min walk to the blue mosque. It is just outside the main centre so is not as busy near the hotel. However by waliking to the end of the street you are in the centre of Istanbul. The tram starton is 2 min walk and i have to say the location is just right. There was three of us in total and the room was slightly small. It can be seen that it is a double room that has had an extra bed put into it. I did ask at reception for a larger room but the only response i got was that is the largest room available, clearly not. The breakfast was ok, you got your eggs, bread, sometimes fruit, cheeses, juices, tea, and cornflakes. Staff were generally nice but we did not really use them much. If i was to come again I would consider staying in the same hotel, due to the location and convenice.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a boutique”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveller1970
Reviews.Content: Good location and staff were reasonably helpful. We booked a double room and perhaps due to our late arrival were allocated a twin. However we were moved to the next day. We stayed on the first floor and the rooms and furnishings are in need of a good clean and refurbishment. Our bathroom was tiny and had a strange bath/shower unit which required a degree of athleticism to get in and out of. Breakfast was ok but no toast and unusual juice.

Reviews.Title: “I Like this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moogeh
Reviews.Content: I Like This Hotel, Good View, Great Location to Reach Easily Istanbul Sightseeing, Nice Staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Location was beyond PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: UkArmand
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this hotel are slightly confusing. When I was booking it I was really conerned that it was going to turn out to be some dump! Thankfully, it wasn't .. Staff were expecting us, despite it being past midnight, check in was smooth .. we were shown to our room which was a twin. It was small but comfortable .. the bathroom also was small but nice and clean, had a shower, towels ..hair dryer. The AC was a godsend, perhaps it would have been better if it was more powerful .. but the fact that it was there after a long day of roasting in the sun was enough for us .. Room had free wireless internet which amazingly worked perfectly unlike in many other hotels where I stayed before .. Service was ok, a lady came to change the towels everyday .. she did not make the beds but maybe because we didnt ask her .. there was a DO NOT DISTURB sign, on the back of which was written 'PLEASE CLEAN MY ROOM' ... we didn't know this and so never put the sign up which perhaps she took to mean we didn't want her to clean ..! This did not bother us much though .. The reception staff were also nice, particularly the guy on the night shift who was extrememly helpful and friendly.. The location of the hotel was excellent .. this is where I was pleased we did not go for any other hotel .. whilst alot of other hotels were near the Sultanahmet area, this one was literally a 2 minute walk away from the Blue mosque, Haghia Sophia, Basilica Cistern and many resturants .. Topkapi Palace was 10-15 minutes away as well.. Couple of problems: walls in the room are pretty thin .. you could hear the phone ringing in the room next door, that was slightly annoying .. and the bathtub may prove potentially problamatic to get in and out of for some .. it's actually quite tricky, tub's pretty high and in the shape of 2 steps .. hard to explain but yes .. that wasn't pleasent .. got used to it though .. maybe an issue if you are old or have back problems .. All in all, whilst the room did not neccesarily look like those on the website lol, it was nice and comfortable enough for us .. I would definitely stay here again ..

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to visit. Location was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Dinky_Dina
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was great, we had no problem, and the staffs were very friendly and helpful. The room were good, recently refurbished. But the air-condition personally I didnâ€™t think was powerful enough. Breakfast in Hotel was good, not the best, but we never had no problem with it. Location was perfect, Blue Mosque, museums and other tourist attractions only a few stop on the tram, which was so easy to get around. The new city only 20mins by tram, but personally didnâ€™t think the city was that great, it was okay. A tip for any travellers will be if you would like to go to the Princess Island then take the tram to Kabatas, where you can get a boat that will take you the island each was only 3 lairs. But if you book via tourist agent or hotel it will charge you 65EURS!!! The Hotel knows a really good restaurant and on that same street all the restaurant are all recommended, food was fab, and tasted great.

Reviews.Title: “If I return to Istanbul, Hotel Antea is my first choice.”
Reviews.Author: SusanCMaryland
Reviews.Content: The service at Hotel Antea was fabulous. We experienced dificulties linking up with our daughter; we were quite distraught and the staff was extremely helpful with locating her. They assisted us each day with directions, maps and advice. The hotel was recently renovated- or so it appeared to us- and the rooms and bathrooms are nicely done. Maids were conscientious when making up our room. Beds were comfortable, which is important because we all have back problems. My husband did complain about the small shower; this was a minor inconvenience. We were pleased with the dining room service and food. The location is excellent- just a 5-10 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar and Blue Mosque and all the attractions in that area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel on a GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Antikis
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the Antea Hotel! We went to the beautiful city of Istanbul for 5 days/ 4 nights and had a wonderful time there. I was travelling with my husband and teenage son. If you're going to Istanbul it's very important you book a hotel in the Sultanahmet area; it's so beautiful to stay in the middle of all these breathtaking mosques. It's 1 or 2 minute walk from it all. The hotel is IN the middle of it all but in a quiet street so you can sleep very good there, no noise from the busy streets. The personel is very friendly and helpfull, but you have to find the 2 or 3 who speak english, otherwise it gets a bit complicated :) The rooms was not big but in very good shape, clean and nice. We had an extra bed in our room for our son but i guess when you are with two adults it's just right. And... who wants to stay in the hotelroom long, besides sleeping, in this wonderfull city.

Reviews.Title: “Women alone don't go there”
Reviews.Author: lin78
Reviews.Content: I strongly reccomend not going to this hotel. i booked a room 3 months ago through a travel agent (he suggested it); it was me and my friend (2 girls). when we arrived, we were told that there had been a communication problem and they were told it was a couple (man and woman) and they had assigned a double room with a french bed. they said the hotel was full and for the first night they could not do anything, but for the following night, if we wanted, they could change us to a twin bed. we agreed (there wasn't another option anyway!) and we were assigned a very weird double room at the 5th floor (elevator only to 4th floor!) with a round bed. it was ok . the day after we went out for several hours and came back exausted; we just wanted to take a shower and rest and so decided to stay there instead of changing rooms for just one night (and having to pack all over again). the guy at the reception though told us to leave the room, and when we said it was ok to stay there for us, he said we had to leave BECAUSE THAT WAS A SUITE AND WE HAD PAID FOR A STANDARD ROOM, changing completely the story from the day before. we were really disappointed and tired and he started being very aggressive at us, saying we had to leave the room right away or pay the extra cost, or else leave. he sent a guy behind us to make sure we made our bags and leave the room immediately. i got very upset and went to my room and locked the door. the manager called me after a while but the story did not change much, he only agreed to give us enough time to rest and make our bags and then call when we were ready. i feel we were treated in such an aggressive and unpolite way because we were 2 women alone, and none of this aggressiveness would have happened if there had been a man with us. unfortunately, there was no other choice than change room, because we were scared, but i hope if anyone is thinking of booking a room there, they first read this review. it's a pity because the hotel is ok and rooms are not so bad, and location is great. but i will never go there again in my life.

Reviews.Title: “A fair choice”
Reviews.Author: lolaborro
Reviews.Content: I would say this is a fair choice for your stay in Istanbul. The rooms are a bit old but overall, it is good value for money. The hotel is convenientely located in a quiet location in the hear of Istanbul, within 1 minute walk from the tram stop 'Cemberlitas'. The rooms are spacious but could do with a bit of updating specially the bathrooms. The breakfast selection is Typical Turkish Breakfast: bread, peeled fruit, olives, cucumber, tomatoes, cheese, scrambled eggs and sausages. On our last night , we had to be moved to their sister hotel just down their road because they are undergoing decoration and their sister hotel was much nicer and the rooms more modern and the price was the same. Maybe after the redecorations, Antea will be as nice as their sister hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Antea Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Piyerloti Cad. 21, Cemberlitas | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 80860, Turkey
